comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of July 16, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F40A1FF9345D13738... notes Runcie as one of the doctors who performed the autopsy on Lulu Biley, the victim in the "Carman Case." NYT of July 9, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F10614FA3F5E13738... indicated that he was a friend and fellow physician of Carman, and was at the Carman house treating Florence Carman's mother for a heart attack the day Florence was arrested.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Bain's photo of the Carman house (scene of the murder), with investigators:

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: swanq:  Thanks for the NYT article which identifies Runcie as one of the doctors who performed the autopsy on Lulu Bailey.  Thanks Wystan for the image of the murder scene.  We will add more details to the image description when we update.
